Posts.EditableText: If you are using the online quest, is there a way you can download it and then upload it onto the downloadable quest? I've been working on my game for a long time now, and I heard that the downloadable version is more reliable and easier to use. I wanted to try this, but I don't wanna lose my game at all. Could someone help me? Is there any instructions that will help me. Anything will do, just please help me.
Posts.HTML: If you are using the online quest, is there a way you can download it and then upload it onto the downloadable quest? I've been working on my game for a long time now, and I heard that the downloadable version is more reliable and easier to use. I wanted to try this, but I don't wanna lose my game at all. Could someone help me? Is there any instructions that will help me. Anything will do, just please help me.

Posts.EditableText:
At your game page you should see the following:
[attachment=0:1kqo2yud]<!-- ia0 -->download.jpg<!-- ia0 -->[/attachment:1kqo2yud]

click download and you can download a game.zip. Extract all file from this file into a directory. You will find an .aslx file (ignore the backup file) which can be edited with the offline version of quest.
Posts.HTML:
At your game page you should see the following:


click download and you can download a game.zip. Extract all file from this file into a directory. You will find an .aslx file (ignore the backup file) which can be edited with the offline version of quest.

Posts.EditableText: Thank you so much. This really helped me out. I don't need to rely on my wifi anymore, thanks again for the support!
